title: Early Amateur Sound Film (1936–37)
brief_description: Amateur filmmaker Archie Stewart used an RCA Sound Camera to document family life from 1935. A member of the Amateur Cinema League, in 1937 he published one of the first articles on amateur sound, ‘A Talkie Movie Maker Speaks’, in the league’s magazine.

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.
